column5: Remembrance day here in our house will not be forgotten! My son Daniel joined the sea cadets 3 years ago. He is now a Master Seaman. His commanding officers realize his devotion and determination to further his carrier in the armed forces. He has been to the base in Kingston for training and next march he will be flown out to BC for further training. In 2012 he will be able to enlist in the armed forces full time. It is hard for a parent to accept a decision like this from their child, but we have accepted it and stand behind him 100%. We are very proud of him, and we will be there for him every step of the way.
I was also in RCSCC Scarborough many many years ago and then went into the Navy.  Your son is making an excellent choice and it's a decision he'll be happy he made for the rest of his life.
As well you should be.  Good for him, he is a bigger man than I am.
What a handsom young man.I feel your pride in this post. thanks
That's wonderful Skeeter, good for him, you must be beaming with pride  Joey
As any great parent would do. Thanks for sharing.
Good to hear Dann.  I know just how proud you are of him too.

I was in Sea Cadets before becoming a reservist.  Was in a rival corps to Lew's, the old Illustrious. A a teen, cadets opened the door to several exciting opportunities. If your son is doing the leadership course out of Quadra he will have a great and rewarding experience.
Skeeter, have you heard this song?  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QrkgV5bl7kQ
I have now Geoff, thanks thanks for all the kind words everyone.  Dann
No prob.  It's a great tune.
skeeter, you should be VERY VERY PROUD of that good looking young man. These are the real hero's in my eyes and should be looked up to....because of these men we can sleep nights in PEACE.  Bob
